http.title: Welcome To DUMAS, Texas
http.html:
Visitors
Residents
Business
Government

Texas Comptroller Leadership Circle
City of Dumas has received the Texas Comptroller Leadership Circle. This award is given to recognize local governments that are striving to meet a high standard for financial transparency online.  Check out award and the public records here.
City Commission

The Dumas City Commission meets every first and third Monday of the month.  The meetings start at 6:30 p.m. and are held in the Commissioner/Municipal Court at the Dumas Police Department.  The meetings are also televised live on Channel 58.  Click here for the latest agenda. 

Welcome to our website
Thank you for visiting the City of Dumas website.  We hope you find the information within informative and helpful.  If you have any questions we can be reached at (806) 935-4101 or by fax at (806) 935-6104.
News and Information
  • RABIES NOTICE!!!!!!

    On January 27, 2019 Animal Control picked up a skunk in the 1200 block of Bennett. The skunk was aggressive and was euthanized. The skunk was sent to Texas Dept. of Health Services Zoonosis Control and tested POSITIVE for Rabies. If you or any pets came into physical contact with this animal please contact Dumas Animal Control at 806-935-3998 for further instructions.
    Click Here for Notice
  • HPO 2019

    The City of Dumas will hold a General Election on May 4, 2019 for the purpose of electing a Mayor and City Commissioners for Place Three (3) and Place Four (4).

    Filing an application for a place on the ballot ends February 15, 2019. Business hours on February 15, 2019 will be 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. to file. You can pick up an application at City Hall, 124 W. 6th Street. Contact Kim Rehkopf at 935-4101, Ext. 100 with any questions.

     Applications filed at this time: Mayor - Bob Brinkmann

                                                        Pat L. Sims - Commissioner Place Four (4)

  •  

    CERTIFICATION OF UNOPPOSED CANDIDATES/CERTIFICACION DE CANDIDATOS UNICOS


    Click Here to view the Document / Pulsar Aqui para ver el Documento

    ORDER OF CANCELLATION / ORDEN DE CANCELACION

    Click Here to view Order of Cancellation / Pulsar Aqui para ver Orden de Cancelacion


  • Volunteer!

    -You Want to Volunteer Click here for more info!

  • Special Notice 

    The City of Dumas adopted a tax rate that will raise more taxes for maintenance and operation than last year's tax rate.

  • Special Notice

    Warning! The City of Dumas only takes payments online through our link that is listed below. We are not contracted by any third party companies to take payments for us.

    https://1.municipal.cc/DUMASTX/webportal/
  • SPECIAL NOTICE

    Multiple City residents have notified the Utility Billing Department in regards to receiving calls from a phone number that appears to be the Dumas Fire Department. Upon answering the call they were connected to an automated message that notified them on their "excellent credit history" and offered "0% interest on all of their current credit cards". As you all know, the City does not participate in any form of cold calling and this scam has the potential to manipulate residents into providing sensitive information. Please let the City Utility Billing department know if you have any questions or concerns. Thank you for your time.
  • Special Notice
    Customer Write off List. Click here to view

    Delinquent account information is never removed from the utility system. The term “write-off” should not be confused with “forgiven”. The amounts are only removed accounts receivable account in the books only.  Efforts continue to be made to collect these debts and are never “forgiven”.

    2018 Tax Rate Change Proposal
    For information about the new Tax rate proposal Click Here.
  • Texas 811 - Call before you dig!
    More Info: Click here
    Website: www.texas811.org
  • Reminder:
    Just a Friendly reminder to please keep the grass and weeds on your property mowed.To make an anonymous report for a tall weed/grass problem, please email the city here.
    Thank You
  • Backflow Testers:
    Noel Venzor  (806)376-8331    John Lauferwiler (806)517-1546
    Gary Ward (806)935-3361    Davy Flores (806)683-8440
    Rick Stevens (806)948-4398    Janie-Adam Lee (806)376-9797
    Curtis Brown (806)333-2564    Lance Ferry (806)679-7754
    Oscar Ramirez (806)336-0510      William (Sonny) E. Scott (806)316-4201
    Hobey Brown (806)374-0407    Ray Buffington  (806)928-0939 
    Jason Rewine (806)395-1668   Leo Britten (806)382-8755
  • Recycling Center Hours
    City Recycling Hours are 9am-Noon & 1-6pm Tuesday - Saturday.  The center is closed Sundays and Mondays.
  • Follow us on Facebook

Some Of Our Programs

Great Careers Start at Alpena Community College!
Auto Service Business Concrete Technology Electrical Systems Marine Technology Medical Assistant Nursing Utility Technology Welding
All Programs
  • Sexual Assault Awareness Month Candlelight Vigil
  • ACC National Champions at Utility Tech Lineman Rodeo
  • Student Nurses Association Pie in the Face Fundraiser
  • Early Registration for Summer and Fall  Starts March 25th
  • Softball Schedule Available Now
  • Healthy Futures Start Here Capital Campaign

Changing Lives Through Education

At Alpena Community College you really can start here and go anywhere!
1,500+
Students get their start every year at ACC
75
With over 75 programs, there's something for everyone
$3 Million
ACC students receive over $3 Million in Federal & State Aid
150
Ranked in the top 150 of all Community Colleges by the Aspen Institute
150,000
ACC students receive $150,000 in institutional scholarships every year

New To ACC?

Alpena Community College offers over 75+ programs, hands-on classes, and instructors with real world experience! 

Not sure which program is right for you? Check out all of our programs to find the perfect fit for your career goals!

The best way to find out if ACC is the right school for you is by visiting our campus. Schedule a tour today with our Admissions Office.

Meeting with your Academic Advisor will help you make sure that you're on track to meet your academic goals!

Find out more about ACC!
  • Athletics
  • Bookstore Information
  • Cancellations & Closures
  • Library & Resources
  • Student Services Center

Athletics

ACC belongs to the Eastern Division Michigan Community College Athletic Association.
Currently, the college fields:
Men's Basketball
Women's Basketball
Cross Country
Women's Softball
Women's Volleyball

Learn More

Bookstore Information

The ACC Bookstore is located in the Besser Technical Center on ACC's main campus and is open to the public Monday - Thursday from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Fridays from 8:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. with extended hours at the beginning of each semester.

The bookstore carries:

  • Textbooks and Course Materials
  • Computer Software at Educational Pricing
  • ACC Logo Wear-shirts, hats, hoodies, etc.
  • Jansport & Under Armour Backpacks
  • Snacks, Beverages, and Candy
  • Art, Drafting, & School Supplies
  • Gift Cards
Learn More

Cancellations & Closures

If ACC is forced to close or if an instructor cancels class for any reason there are a number of ways that students can find out. The best way to know is to sign up for School Messenger!

Learn More

Library & Resources

Located in the Newport Center Building, the Library and A-V areas provide intellectual access to recorded knowledgeand information consistent with the present and anticipated teaching and research responsibilities of Alpena Community College. The Alpena Community College academic library collection is generally most suitable for adult use; those obtaining library cards must be a student at ACC or its University Center, or be a non-student at least 18 years old.

Learn More

Student Services Center

Alpena Community College students can come to The Student Services Center for the help they need to succeed! All services are FREE!

Services include:

  • Free tutoring
  • Free proofreading services
  • Free presentations
  • Study Skills & Writing Help
  • Disability Services
  • Free Printing
  • And More!
Learn More

Terms and Policies

Academic Policies Articulation Agreement Campus Forms Emergency Procedures Equal Employment Opportunity and Nondiscrimination FERPA - Student Notification of Rights Financial Aid Policies Healthy Futures Start Here Quality Assurance Tuition and Fees Accessibility

Reports & Data
